headline: Why Morgan Stanley, Goldman Sachs lifted their oil price targets
summary: Crude oil (BZ=F, CL=F) prices have been rallying this year, even as analysts entered 2026 expecting a sizable supply surplus. CIBC Private Wealth senior energy trader Rebecca Babin joins Morning Brief host Julie Hyman to explain why crude oil supply has been impacted and why several firms are raising their oil price targets. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: How The Informa (LSE:INF) Story Is Shifting With New Targets Buybacks And AI Questions
summary: Analysts have kept Informa’s Fair Value price target unchanged at £10.84, while individual published targets currently range around figures such as £9.75, £10.80 and £13.30. Those different targets line up with a split between bullish voices, who are comfortable with higher upside bands, and more cautious views that flag execution and AI related risks. headline: How The SSE (LSE:SSE) Investment Story Is Evolving As Analyst Targets Cluster Around £26
summary: Analysts covering SSE have been adjusting their price targets, with a recent cluster forming around £26.00 compared with earlier levels closer to £25.00. These shifts reflect small tuning moves, such as the step from 2,500 GBp to 2,600 GBp, as research houses refresh their views while still flagging execution and regulatory risks in the background. headline: Majority of States Exceed Revenue Targets, Classified as ‘Stable’
summary: BOSTON, February 23, 2026--Morgan Stanley Investment Management (MSIM) today released the 13th annual State of the States report, which indicates a stable credit outlook for most states and includes analysis of new factors tied to the global economy and the shifting balance between federal funding and state-driven support for national programs. The State of the States report examines the financial health of the 50 states and Puerto Rico and leverages MSIM’s proprietary ratings methodology.

The State of the States report examines the financial health of the 50 states and Puerto Rico and leverages MSIM’s proprietary ratings methodology.

headline: How The Cleveland-Cliffs (CLF) Narrative Is Shifting On Tariffs Valuation And Insider Signals

headline: Why The Narrative Around NRG Energy (NRG) Is Shifting With New Targets And Deal Progress
summary: The internal fair value estimate for NRG Energy has been adjusted slightly, moving from US$201.96 to US$202.85. This sits alongside Street research where some analysts have taken price targets up, including one at US$153, while others have cut targets by double digits, keeping overall ratings closer to the middle of the range. headline: How The Investment Story For Publicis Groupe (ENXTPA:PUB) Is Shifting After Mixed Analyst Calls
summary: Publicis Groupe is back in focus after analysts trimmed their Fair Value estimate from €113.67 to €108.64, signalling a more cautious central view of what the shares may be worth. Behind that adjustment, recent Street commentary shows a split between bullish voices lifting targets to around €109 to €115 and more cautious houses cutting their targets by €5 to €10. As you read on, you will see how these differing calls shape the evolving story around Publicis and what to watch as the narrative...
